Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Schmackerin-C1 (XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Deduced from the genome.Activity: weakly active against B. pyocyaneus (p. aeruginosa) (MIC 50 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 50 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 100 ug/ml).Toxicity: hemolysis not detected: not hemo.lytic. Updated 5/2020; 7/2021 Data reformatted Jan2023.
Literature Information.Author: Yang X, Lee WH, Zhang Y.2011, China, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: J Proteome Res. 2012 Jan 1;11(1):306-19. Epub 2011 Nov 18.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Extremely Abundant Antimicrobial Peptides Existed in the Skins of Nine Kinds of Chinese Odorous Frogs
